chunks.text: In this video, we will see how to add CSS to an HTML page.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: There are three ways to add CSS to HTML.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: The first way is inline CSS which is used as a style attribute and added to HTML pages.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: The second way is internal CSS.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: Internal CSS means to put a style tag and put the CSS of that HTML in the style tag of the HTML page.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: And after that, the most used is external CSS.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: Make a .css file and put all your styles in that .css file.
chunks.title: Inline, Internal & External CSS

chunks.text: In this video, I will tell you very closely what is the difference between the three, when to use and when to avoid.
